root.name: Football Manager 2010
root.description: Football Manager 2010 continues the series' tradition of rolling out new features and refinements every year.Notable Additions ChangesThe tactics system from the previous games has been all but changed entirely in this installment. Dozens of new possibilities have been added to the system including the capacity to strictly define individual player roles. The ability to shout specific instructions and tactics to the controlled team during a match is also a new addition. Newcomers to FM will be pleased with the brand new match analysis tools. Every action in a match is recorded in a post-game report which can elaborate on where particular tactics/strategies are working or failing.The media aspect of the game has not been overhauled to the extent of the tactics system, but some enhancements exist nonetheless. Managers can subscribe to different channels of news or to specific individuals even. The news center which displays information about the entire game world has also been changed in order to show stories that are more relevant to the game player.While the scouting system has not been changed dramatically, the areas a club's board will allow you to scout have been changed dramatically. This is not always a good change particularly when playing in the lower leagues.Injuries have become somewhat more realistic with amorphous return-to-action dates instead of the exact "this player will be out of action for six weeks" reports from the physios in the previous version.Visually, FM10 sports a brand new new look when compared to the previous games in the series. Much of the interface has been condensed and cleaned up in order to aid newcomers who might feel overwhelmed by the scope of the game world. The 3D match engine has also seen improvements.
